reviewText: this movie has a lot of crude humor.by ctude i mean whole parts centered around a dogs private parts and raw sewage on a persons body.yep,pretty  nasty.no need for this i say.well,joe is searching for his parents and ends up on a talk show.he goes through his entire wild story starting with being abandoned at the grand canyon as a child and goes on up to the present day.that one loser from a talk show on hbo is the talk show host.he sucks!kid rock plays a redneck who messes with joe all the time.the material here is not suitable for the underage types.it is a good movie all in all and can be enjoyed by most.there is one sexy chick named brandy in it but.........yup ya guessed it,she keeps her shirt on.theres this other skank too.so,its good is the point if you can handle a few nasty parts.

reviewText: From Rules of Engagement to Joe Dirt to Grown ups, David Spade has amazing range as an actor and he makes each one of his characters lovable.  Love Joe Dirt!

Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: This is a fantastic movie which will make you laugh, cry and stand up to cheer. I was never a David Spade fan until seeing him play Joe Dirt. It is a movie you will want to watch at least once (maybe twice) a year, for forever, because it is just that entertaining of a movie and a great soundtrack that you will also want to purchase; so go ahead and order the soundtrack when you order the movie, you will be glad you did so you can add both to your movie and music collection.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: David Spade is one of those actors who I find genuinely hysterical.  There is just something about his shtick that really makes me chuckle, a lot.  Even when his films are ridiculously stupid, I can't help but feel that he elevates them to this other level of entertaining.  That same rationale can be applied to `Joe Dirt', a film that really has no grounds to stake a claim at `funny' and yet, it really is.  It is as predictable and manipulative as these `dumb comedies' come and yet, there is always Spade to make it all go down smoother.  Spade plays Joe Dirt, a hillbilly simpleton in search of his parents.  Being abandoned at the Grand Canyon in his youth weighed heavy on him, and so Joe recalls his adventures in a way that should make us walk away, but it doesn't.  YES, this film could have been much better, but much better is not what you expect when David Spade dons a mullet and pronounces his name `Dear-tay'.  What you expect is a shamelessly predictable gross-out comedy that will make you laugh out loud.  In that respect, `Joe Dirt' works.  Oh yeah, and that 'Silence of the Lambs' spoof is funnier than anything pulled out of 'Scary Movie'; or at least nearly so!
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: SNL Alumn David Spade stars in this Forrest Gump spoof produced by Robert Simonds. Joe Dirt (David Spade) is a redneck janitor cleaning a radio station, when he is found LA Radio personality Zander Kelly (Dennis Miller) and put on Zander's show. Joe tells his life story to listeners which consists of, working at a number of terrible jobs, findng a belived comet, but later finds out it is made out of feces, making out with who he later suspects is his sister, falling in love with a girl (Brittney Daniel) and her dog, and most importantly trying to find his parents who he lost at the Grand Canyon when he was young. The movie is okay but it lacks the laughs that other Robert Simonds productions had like, Billy Madison, or Dirty Work. It also stars  Kid Rock, and Malcom n the middle's Erik Per Sullivan.
summary: Another Average Comedy from executive Producer Adam Sandler
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: One of the best movies ever, David Spade in his greatest A.F. (After Farley) movie. Spade plays a steriotypical redneck who tells his story about his search for his parents to a radio DJ Zander Kelly (Dennis Miller), about life with his foster parents, finding a meteor, meeting Brandy and Charlie, Buffalo Bob, and Chris Walken as Clem the janitor.Go BUY this movie right now, critics have no idea what they were talking about when they bashed this movie.MULLETS ROCK!!!
summary: Does your mother sew? Well BOOM get her to sew that.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: a funny movie, a guilty pleasure. No one in my family thinks I should watch it. I like it though, It's always silly except the part where he's put in the pit, not funny.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: The Story of Joe Dirt is a Story that Deserves to be told, it's Funny, Uplifting and... Nice, which was a Change from the Vile, Mean, Gross out comedy I went in Expecting (and of course... Wanted to see). Sure, it has moments of Ingenious Gross out comedy, but At it's Core, and for most of it's Running time, it has a lot of Heart. David Spade's Leap to Big Screen Leading man is a Successful one, like the films producer Adam Sandler, and their Mutual Friend Rob Schneider, Spade is the Underdog with a Heart of Gold and I for one couldn't Wait to see him come out On Top.Spade is (you guessed it) Joe Dirt, a Mullet-wearing Loser whose life has been Fraught with Failure and Overcome by Opposition, well Not Quite overcome, as Dirt is an Undying Optimist. He is brought onto a Radio show one day by a Satirical DJ (Dennis Miller) to be the Butt of all the Jokes, but as his story unfolds, the DJ, the Listeners, the Entire Country get caught up in his story and he becomes a National Hero.The film is Always Amusing, Sometimes Hysterical one. It features a Wonderful Supporting cast that, no matter How much screen time they get, they Give they're all. Dennis Miller is Naturally a Hilarious man, he is also one of the most Underrated comedians in America, I just Love the guy, he can do no wrong. Brittany Daniels is Sugary Sweet and Boundlessly Beautiful as Joe's Sweetheart. Jaime Pressly is Endlessly Sexy and Fiendishly Funny as a Strange Acquaintance of Joe's. Brittany and Jaime are both Unbelievable Beautiful actresses and they also prove themselves to be Quite Talented Comediennes.Christopher Walken gives a cameo that threatens to Steal the film out from under Joe's feet, he is a Brilliant performer and I Await the day when he takes on a Full-Blown Lead role in a Comedy. It could Happen, don't Poo-poo the idea straight away, just think about it. Rosanna Arquette gives an Amusing performance as well, the one performance in the film that Stands out as Genuinely Bad is Kid Rock's performance. This man is Not an Actor, he is bad, there is no other way of putting it. He looks Very uncomfortable in front of the camera when he is Supposed to be playing a Bully Character. "Joe Dirt" features a Lot of other known faces and Good performances, but to list them all would Bore you and Annoy me, but I will anyway. Fred Ward, Adam Beach and Joe Don Baker. That wasn't so bad.Overall, it is a Pleasing "Forest Gump"-ish tale of Overcoming Adversity, Accepting Yourself and your Situation and making the audience laugh. I went in thinking it would be a Silly Gross out comedy and I came out Shocked because I'd just seen a Good Film, with a Good Story. Man, I didn't see that coming at all.Oh, one last thing. When Joe heads to Florida, keep a eye out for a certain funny man from "The Waterboy".
summary: Far better than Expected, in Story and in Laughs.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: i dont know wut movies the other reviewers saw but i gotsta say that this is tha funniest movie i've seen this year so far. even my woman who dont like these type of movies had her crackin up. its about a janitor joe dirt(david spade) who gets picked on and bullied on all tha time, tells his life story over tha radio. i really don't want to spoil tha movie for u folks who havent seen this. so just believe what im saying. if u have a good sense of humor u should find this movie funny. like i said its the funniest movies i've seen so far i would pay to watch it again in tha theater.

reviewText: Okay some people like "Dumb and Dumber" and I use to wonder why. Well they are certainly entitled to their opinion. After laughing so hard at this movie I have to admit I see their point too. Let's face it their are some movies that may not have great acting or even much of a new storyline but they are just plain funny. Any fans of movies like "A Night at the Roxbury", "The Waterboy", and "Deuce Bigolow, Male Gigolo" should find this funny. Certainly fans of Saturday Night Live should like it. I have seen men, women, kids, and even grandparents laugh at this one. Considering they made a TV series based on this type person, it must have had something people liked. At least rent it, I don't think you will be disappointed.

reviewText: Alot people say this movie stunk in general. Well in general compared to big all time classics then yeah it does, i guess.This stands for its own and is a really good comedy.You just need a common sence of humar to enjoy this movie.The movie seems like a knock off of Forest Gump almost in the way the movie is diplayed.The story is told from a stereo type  redneck. His name is Joe Dirt. He tells his tale of his life to a radio DJ and at first the DJ takes it all as a joke.Many people start to really like Joe's story and soon Joe's story is in full effect.Joe's story takes off way back from the point of getting lost at the Grand Canyon.He meets some very odd people and the love of his life along the way.All he wants is to be reunited with his long alost family.Audio wise it's really good.You get some rock songs to mix into the movie.The movie may seem corny, but alot of the comedies out today don't stack up to Joe Dirts status.Rent it for the weekend and get alot of laughs outta it.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: For a typical low-brained Hollywood comedy of this era, it was a pretty nice film. Of course, few if any modern-day comedies are "family fare" and this one isn't either but the lead character is a gentle, harmless guy.David Spade is very entertaining as "Joe Dirt," a down-and-out nice guy (but not exactly pure, either) who tells his tale of trying to find his parents to sleazy disc jockey "Zander Kelly" (Dennis Miller). Brittany Daniel is an attractive, likable female lead.It's a fast-moving hour-and-a-half. Some of the scenes are outrageous, such as a dog getting his - can I say this? - testicles stuck to the porch. Yes, it's good family fare!! Ha. Ha. No, really, this was a funny film and worth looking for if you need a laugh. I'm surprised there wasn't a sequel.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Did I actually read a review here by same lamer trying to compare this movie to The Shawshank Redemption? WHAT? Who in their right mind compares a comedy to a drama anyways?If you want some laughs... I thought this was a greater movie than The Shawshank Redemption! I guess it's just me, but i didn't find Shawshank to be a barrel of laughs kind of flick! ;P
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: GUILTY PLEASURE TIME!!!  I love "Joe Dirt"!  David Spade has captured perfectly the white-trash aesthetic here.  The clothes, the trailer-parks, the music.  "Van Halen, not Van Hagar!"  We are completely in sympathy with this mullet-headed poor excuse for a redneck as he seeks out his white-trash parents who abandoned him at the Grand Canyon.  I have known Joe Dirts in my life(truth be told I'm related to some), and David Spade is him.  Good supporting turn by Dennis MIller as a radio talk-show host who uses Joe's poignant story for his audience's personal amusement.  And Christopher Walken plays Clem.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: david spade is so funny in this movie.if your looking for a movie that will make you laugh,this is a good one
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Yes, the humor is silly and often intentionally stupid, but I can't help but love it.  If it's more cerebral or subtle humor that you want, you will not find it here (beyond the excellent mantra: "life is a garden, dig it," that is).  The Joe Dirt experience is all about good laughs from silly jokes, wacky characters and ridiculous situations.  Highly recommended for those who like 70's rock, nostalgic hair styles, and anyone who pulls for the underdog.  Joe Dirt will give you that, and some gutbusting laughter to boot.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: This is a great movie that I saw a while back, and lost my copy. I was pleased to find a replacement, however, I just ordered it, and have not received it yet.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: As I view all comedy as being subjective, I will leave it to you to decide if this movie is funny. Personally, I found it funny, but not the funniest thing I had ever seen. The humor is above the level of "Dude, Where's My Car?", but below the level of, say, "Road Trip." David Spade's facial hair is one of the funniest things in the movie. Look for great roles by Dennis Miller, Christopher Walken, Kevin Nealon, Rosanna Arquette, Kid Rock, Jaime Pressly, and others. The DVD has a few very good extra features. The deleted scenes were, for the most part, deleted for a reason. The outtakes and bloopers are very funny. The coup de grace is the "David Spade Commentary". Spade's commentary is funnier by far than the movie. Spade also explains why many of the jokes weren't as funny as they could have been: PG-13 rating requirements. All in all, if you saw the movie and liked it, I would recommend the DVD for its extra features.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: I've always appreciated David Spade's sense of humor and have liked the films he's been in.  He was also one of the better SNL regulars.This film should not be taken so seriously, it's a silly comedy about a boy who has a mullett haircut glued to his head.  He is searching for his family, when all along he knows who is real family is.Droning and boring Dennis Miller plays a dj that brings Joe on the air to spill his story, thus, this is the entire movie.It had some laughs, many of them were stupid laughs, but nonetheless, I have to admit I found myself laughing.  Maybe I'm a bit ashamed as this certainly isn't one of the greatest comedies of all time.  It does get a little trite and predictable, but Spade gets a few good laughs in.Rent at your own risk.  I didn't pay for this rental, so I can't say it's worth the fee.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: I really pay attention to movies I can watch over and over again. Movies that never get old, even though I know what is going to happen. When the surprise and suspense is gone, if a movie still grabs my attention then it is a keeper. This is one of those movies. There is enough pop culture references to keep anyone entertained. The story is actually great, heartfelt, and feel-good. The comedy is still funny, even after all these years. Me and my friends still quote this movie. This is definitely a movie I would recommend to everyone who is a fan of comedies. Own this movie!
summary: One of the best comedies in the past 20 years
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: I just saw this for the first time today and I was surprised.  I went into it thinking that it was going to be yet another cheesy "comedy" that lacked comedic insights.  Not so.  This is a funny, entertaining movie, and I might even go so far as to say that it had some depth sprinkled about the storyline here and there.  It's probably the funniest movie that I've seen in the last few years.  It's not quite 5-star material though, but it is thoroughly entertaining from start to finish.  Definitely worth a rental.
summary: Life is a garden - Dig it and make the most of it
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: "Joe Dirt" are some of those films you are really supposed to dislike: it's crude, has more stupid and immature jokes a viewer can take, and the title...well...it's original.Yes, when the film came out in the spring of 2001, the film received scathing reviews and dissapointing box-office numbers. But it seems to have an interesting cult following. It's not just the rednecks who like the film, but just viewers who just want to have a good time, ignore all the stupid critics, and have a laugh. It's a guilty pleasure spectacle! The film is so stupid, it's funny! The story has heart, a fine cast including the lovable David Spade, the always akward, but hilarious Christopher Walken, and fine quick-paced editing that keeps the viewer in tune.All in all, it's a hillbillie masterpiece! Just get the film, it's more worthy then any Farrelly Brothers flick.
summary: Ignore the critics...IT'S A FUNNY MOVIE!
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: One of the worst films in the world. It is a waste of time and is NOT funny!Rating: PG-13 for Language and Violence

Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Joe Dirt is a black comedy. Not as black as you can get, but dark. I don't have a problem with that, in fact, I love black comedies. But only when they can build up to the laughter, when it actually means something. This is not the case in Joe Dirt, the comedy - which is at times hilarious, at others laughably unfunny - is just quick snippits and then back to the story that has David Spade looking for his parents. That is not entirely bad, but the story falls flat later on in the movie because it has no more supporting material. Other than that, the performances aren't that impressive; yeah, their not supposed to be because it's the enjoyment and the comedy that matters, but it would be nice to see some great performances reminiscent of maybe Peter Sellers in a modern movie. The film is also very unrealistic. But, this movie has a cool hair-do and some original characters, which make it bearable enough to sit through. But, sometimes you just wonder why all the people around you are laughing at such typical jokes. I would most highly recommend Joe Dirt to a teenage audience, they'll get hyped up about the `coolness' and enjoy talking about it on the ride home.
summary: Not really worth the time, but amusing sometimes.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: NOTHING  to  say  about  this  pathetic  attempt.  It  is  just  plain  bad.  The  only  redeeming  feature  was  that  Christopher  Walken  is  ten  times  as  funny  as  David  Spade! Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Another reviewer stated he couldn't understand why professional critics give "films" like "Lost In Translation" five stars, and mainstream comedies such as this two. The reason is quite simple: It boils down to the "if you can't understand it, it must be deep" maxim by which directors hawk erstwhile incomprehensible fare as somehow profound.Actually, I rate "Joe Dirt" a bit higher than "Lost in Translation," giving the latter three stars. I actually enjoyed Sofia Coppola's movie, but found the cinematography a bit wanting.However, "Joe Dirt" has been slammed as a formulaic comedy. Indeed, that it is. However, the producers of this flick never make any intimations that this movie was anything other than what it was. Unlike "American Beauty," a compilation of suburban cliches and stale anti-bourgeoise gripes, "Joe Dirt" doesn't pretend it's the latest profundity emanating from the Dalai Lama.And, what it is is good fun, some gross gags and a somewhat autobiographical story for David Spade. It's about dirty Joe Dirt, an abandoned orphan now grown up and living in the broom closet of a classic rock radio station. He's discovered by shock jock Zander Kelly (played by the ever droll Dennis Miller), who exploits Joe's life story for the entertainment of his radio audience.Like so many movies of its kind, it uses the road trip analogy borrowed by so many comedies ever since Homer's "Odyssey." Joe -- who was abandoned as a child at Grand Canyon  -- is searching for the parents who mislaid him so many year before. Along the way we meet tough guys that bully Joe (Joe Don Baker and Kid Rock), a real hot country gal (Brittany Daniel), an ex-mafioso hiding out as a janitor in a witness protection program (Christopher Walken, as suave as ever) and an American Indian shilling fireworks (Adam Beach)."Joe Dirt" has a good number of sight gags and lots of literal toilet humor, involving crap meteorites and a-bomb RV toilet tanks ("I got the poo on me!" Joe cries, covered in dung). Walken has the movie's best line: "It's your tone, it's all wrong. Do it again, and I'll stab you in the face with a soldering iron.") There's even a hilarious send-up of "The Silence of the Lambs" in which transvestite Buffalo Bob (Brian Thompson) imprisons Joe in a hole in the floor.Best of all, Joe's life is set to a great soundtrack of classic rock songs from the late 1970s and early 80s by great bands such as Lynyrd Skynyrd, the Doobie Brothers, Bachman-Turner-Overdrive, April Wine, George Thorogood and the Destroyers and Cheap Trick.No, "Joe Dirt" is not nearly as profound as "Citizen Kane" nor as funny as "Young Frankenstein," but it's a solid film, and lots of fun, if you don't take a silly film as this seriously.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Joe Dirt is the gut-bustingly funny tale of a character by the same name, payed by David Spade.  He's a complete loser working as a janitor when he gets spotted and highlighted by a radio host (Dennis Miller) named Xander Kelly.  The show gives us the privilege of hearing about Joe's life, and the hilarity ensues.First and foremost, Joe is pathetic looking.  He has a surgically attached mullet, porkchop sideburns, and facial hair that looks like the results of bad inbreeding.  What's more, he is absolutely clueless about how stupid he looks.  He's so worthless, in fact, that his parents abandoned him at the Grand Canyon, and it's this abandonment that begins his amazing journey.Soon enough, we come to see Joe Dirt as not so pathetic, and we begin to empathize with him.  He's just an honest guy, looking for his family and love, but just happens to look horrible.There are far too many hilarious scenes to mention, but a few noteworthy ones are when he meets an Indian named Kicking Wing who owns a fireworks stand in the desert.  In a matter of no time, the two are shooting fireworks into fuel, and causing massive explosions.  The next thing you know, Joe Dirt is getting septic tanks dumped on his head, dog's ballls are getting frozen to winter porches, and beatdowns occur at oil derricks.  All the while Joe is completely oblivious, spouting off lines like, "Life's a garden; dig it".If you like to laugh out loud, then this is the movie for you.  It's highly recommended.  The entire movie provides laughs, and there are great cameos by several stars, namely Christopher Walken, who are intertwined in ingenious scenarios, one more outrageous than the previous.  David Spade absolutely nails the Joe Dirt persona, and doesn't allow for a single dull second.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: I always respected David Spade as a sly and witty comedian, that is until I found out that he wrote the script to Joe Dirt.  I can basically sum up this movie in one word: unwatchable.  Joe Dirt plays like Pee-Wee's Big Adventure only the characters aren't 1/10th as interesting or funny.  Joe Dirt is an adventure that takes our mullet haired, skynyrd listening, AC/DC T-Shirt wearing friend on a quest to find the parents who deserted him 10 years ago.  The series and sequence of events of the film are a collage of thrown together vignettes that simply just don't work, on ANY level.  In fact, the funniest moments in Joe Dirt are seeing the writing on the t-shirts that he is wearing (the funniest being I Choked Linda Lovelace).  There are some moderately big stars in Joe Dirt like Christopher Walken, Dennis Miller, and Rosanna Arquette; all I can say is that they must have owed Spade a favor.  David Spade is at his best when his dead-pan sarcasm is allowed to shine through.  In this film, Joe Dirt is not sarcastic rather Spade tries to pull him off as a lovable backwoods kid.  He is totally unbelievable in this part because he is the true opposite of everything that Joe Dirt is, and the public knows it. In short, stay away from this film at all costs, this comes from a huge Farley, Sandler, and Schneider fan.
summary: Even the Mullet Can't Save this Train Wreck
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: That's why dad named you Joe Dirt instead of Nutamakin!  hah this movie was an instant classic in my eyes, then again I've always really enjoyed David Spade - if you like him and Christopher Walkin, you'll like this movie, epiclly hilarious, and non-stop white trash jokes!  my favorite  "okay! your my sister, your my sister"
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Hmmm, what to say about this movie? It was interesting. Yes, it was pretty funny at times, and not a waste of time, but paying for it would be a waste in my opinion. If you can see it on a movie channel you already have or on TV, watch it then. His adventures and stories are amusing, but the comedy angle on this one just gets old after the first few mullet jokes! I'm giving this one 3 stars instead of two just for the presence of Dennis Miller. His cynical, sarcastic radio personality, not at all far from his TV show persona, is funny in the movie. Plus I just like him anyway, so it was like a bonus to see him. If you enjoy Adam Sandler type flicks, you'll like this one, but for anyone else, you've been warned.

Title: Joe Dirt

reviewerName: John Baranyai "Book Nerd And Ex High School G...
reviewText: In this movie we see Joe Dirt  played by David Spade who works as a janitor in a radio staion. Joe is asked to  be interviewed on air by a DJ who seems intent on making Joe to be a figure of fun. However as the movie progresses Joe becomes a much admired celebrity as his life story is slowly revealed. This movie features the very talented Christopher Walken as a fellow janitor with a secret and the absolutely gorgeous Jaime Pressley who is Joe's Love Interest for awhile . The movie also features a hard rocking soundtrack which was handpicked by guitarist Waddy Wachtel who played on Linda Ronstadts album 'Simple Dreams". A very funny story, lots of likeable characters and a great soundtrack!!! What else could you ask for except maybe one of those Tee shirts that Joe wears on which is printed "I Choked Linda Lovelace!!!"
summary: This Movie Is A Gem And The Soundtrack Really Rocks Too!
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Joe Dirt[David Spade],is a trailer trash simpleton abondoned by his parents when he was eight years old[he did'nt know that at the time]so he set out on a quest to find them.But life throws him tough punches...doing a lot of odd jobs and dealing with a lot of odd people and he does'nt seem to have a clue about very much,especially love.The movie is actually in the form a story that Joe is telling to a DJ[Dennis Miller]at a studio where he was working as janitor.So get the movie and enjoy!
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: This movie has kind of got everything in it... a little comedy, a little action, a little romance, and a little adventure.What is it About?:Joe Dirt is about a white-trash trailer guy who gets lost at the Grand Canyon when he is a kid.  He works at a radio station as a janitor.  He is called into a radio show and tells his life story.  He tells you about what he did trying to find his parents and inspires the entire world.  "Life's a garden, dig it".  In the story you learn about how he went through life with nothing but a dog and a friend.  In the end there is a twist that will surprise everyone.This was a hilarious movie.  It's worth buying because I've watched at least 10 times.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: The struggle that is the Joe Dirt, in each of us, is portrayed on celluloid with the respect and dignity of a Greek tradgedy or Shakespearean classic.I am Joe Dirt, and so are you. We all want to be that cool guy with the silver 1977 Trans Am, but when you look inside and accept circumstances beyond your control, you realize, that you indeed are cool.Being a carnie, a janitor, an abandoned child, a wanderer, or a hot-air tooth balloonist is no mystery to anyone, we've all done it. Hence we embrace our everyday character that makes humanity a population of Dirt.We all have our own 'wig' glued to our heads. Some are not happy neutering animals, cleaning porta-johns, or making lunch trays, even if the money is good. Money is not life or happiness, that is the secret to Joe Dirt. The same secret that we all know but need to discover for ourselves.I have been mooned by airport pilots, I have been impotent and could only be aroused by fantasies of incest, I have shared tender moments with serial killers, I have learned to share my feelings in basements with those others would consider strange.This is not a comedy, this is life. Accept and embrace the Joe Dirt that is in you. God Bless all Joe Dirts and peace to those who drive 1977 Trans Ams.
summary: In the tradition of Gone with the Wind and Casablanca.....
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: People that say it is predictable and the same old thing don't watch very many movies. If you can't tell from the movie poster or previews that it is the same thing then you are stupid. But that's not the point. The point is is that there are some VERY funny parts and a VERY hot leading lady. Mix in some cool outakes and a pretty decent DVD menu and you've got another solid SNL alumni movie. To all those people that say it's the same old thing then I have a clue for you: stop watching them, and we won't have to read your same old review. DANG!
summary: Yea It's the Same Thing, That's Why It's Good
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: This is the story of a guy named Joe Dirt, who while working as janitor at a radio station is pulled onto the show to be the butt of the host's (Dennis Miller) jokes. But once he is on the show and begins to tell his story, they find more than just a hilariously pitiful redneck with a hideous wig grafted to his head. Joe Dirt is a guy that has had every kind of misfortune, including losing his parents on a vacation at the Grand Canyon, and has still kept his head and his hopes up. Without the comedy the story might be a little lame, and without the story there wouldn't be enough jokes to fill a feature film, but together they make a great movie. I don't usually like "mindless comedies", but for some reason I loved this one. Maybe it was because Joe Dirt is such an up-beat, lovable character. You should definitley give this one a try.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Never mind the dumbass critics. This movie is hilarious from start to finish. I liked it allot but not as much as Dickie Roberts.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: This movie was very good, and how the critics picked on it disturbs me. Its pretty funny and the acting by  David Spade its pretty good. It was one of those movies that are under appreciated , and its really cheap so its definitely worth the money.

reviewText: i loved this movie, I was actually shocked that I liked this movie as much as I did. I say this is a must see.

reviewText: Joe Dirt was a good, funny movie.  It had a solid storyline, and was a story to be heard.  David Spade was great is this movie, and Dennis Miller helped make this a laugh out loud comedy.  Though the story came off a little strange in some sence, I'd reccomend this as a movie to be rented, rather than bought.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: After watching this film, the first thing that came to mind was "Forrest Gump."  This silly comedy gives you a fun story that you'd expect from guys like Sandler and Spade, but with this goofy, feel-good storyline.  Spade plays "Joe Dirt," a dim-witted, overly positive redneck who tells his story of searching for his lost parents to Dennis Miller, who plays one of those annoying morning DJ-types.  All along his journey, he ends up meeting odd characters and winds up in outrageous situations like Hanks' "Gump."  As the film progresses, Los Angeles(where the radio station is located) becomes captivated by the simpleton's plight and he becomes a local hero.As with any film starring Spade, this movie has some very silly situations, but you can't help but laugh at them no matter how stupid they are.  This is one of those movies that falls under the category of "guilty pleasure."One glaring omission from this film is Chris Farley, who, if alive, would have definitely been in this film.  Without Farley, however, Spade does a solid job and gives the viewer what to expect:  sophomoric comedy.One note:  "Dirt" is from Louisiana, so was the "Waterboy."  This seemed to offend a lot of people from Louisiana because they felt that both films degraded people from the Pelican State.  I'm from Louisiana, and I wasn't offended in the least bit.  If anything, these films show the resiliency of the Bayou State's people and their "never give up" attitude, albeit in two rather buffoonish characters.  Just remember that these characters are so over the top, that you'd have to be an idiot to believe that everyone from Louisiana is so dim-witted.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: This is a great movie if you are in the mood for something fun and light-hearted.  The characters are hilarious, and you find yourself really feeling for Joe.  There is some crude humor in this movie, so if you aren't up for that, it might not be the movie for you.Despite previous reviews, complaining that Rosanna Arquette was not in the movie, she is.  She played Charlene, the Gator World woman, but was not credited.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: When I heard that David Spade walked out of his own movie, I just thought to myself "FORGET SEEING THAT ONE!" Well, later that month my teacher brought in a movie for us to watch, RAVING how funny it was and what do ya know...JOE DIRT. Since I had nothing to do, I decided to actually watch it. BELIEVE ME, "Joe Dirt" is as stupid as stupid can get. See it if you want, but I would NEVER watch it AGAIN. I don't know why David Spade wasted his time...
summary: Yeah, um, David Spade HIMSELF walked out of it
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Okay...this is one of those dirty secrets that one tends to keep hidden away...I really liked this film.  If you understand what it is...a silly lark that is not to be taken seriously at all!...That is, it is a film where you do not expect to think...nor even WANT to think at all!If you grew up in the late 70's to late 80's you knew guys like this...you may even know a few now!..."Van Halen man...not Van HAGAR!!!"  You knew guys like Robbie, "Def Leppard SUCKS!!!"  You wanted girls like Jill, "A Hemi?" and you wanted a HEMI!!!After seeing this you can go back to claiming how much you are into foreign films that have such deep meanings you never figure them out...but for now...LIFE'S A GARDEN...DIG IT!!!
summary: Three Stars Is Really Good In My Book

Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: This is one of those movies that's so stupid, it's funny... There are a host of amusing characters that Joe Dirt encounters along his journey to find the white-trash parents who abandoned him in his youth. Joe Dirt learns from each of them, and vice versa - and there are funny moments all along.It certainly doesn't compare all too well when held up to Spade's previous work with Chris Farley in Tommy Boy and Black Sheep, but it's got enough stupid humor to keep most comedy fans happy. I enjoyed this movie a great deal and I recommend it highly.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: This is not a film that is for everyone, and some may find the humor in this film to be too crude to their liking, but I honestly enjoyed this film and its storyline. Joe Dirt is a funny character, and his adventures (or misadventures) are varied and entertaining. There's some really funny parts, like when Joe is asking the Native American about his fireworks. Definitely a film to rent before you decide to buy, but a good film it is!
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: After seeing "Croushing Tiger, Hidden Dragon" with my sister, I decided not to see it again when we all went to the theatre. Instead, me and my mom saw this movie. Money well spent.David Spade is funny. This movie is actually funny and doesn't just say that it is. I'm not joking, the movie is funny. The supporting cast is wonderful too.As for story, theres a big one. The whole movie is Joe's life story and it is pretty interesting. It's not like the bubble boy at all where everyone sort of wraps into each other or something. No, its not like the bubble boy so don't even compare them. This movie is actually funny though. Kid Rock, Jamie Pressly, Christopher Walken, and Dennis Miller all do great jobs, but the movie does a successful job of making me laugh and im sure it will make you laugh too.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: This is one of the movies that you I can watch over and over again.  I ordered it because my husband and I collect movies and we simply realized we did not have this one.  Which is a mistake.  If you like silly comedies (like Tommy Boy, Dumb & Dumber, ect) then this movie is for you!
summary: Great comedy to watch over & over
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Movies like JOE DIRT can't be evaluated for script or quality values.  It's a raucous, sometimes unfunny, but always entertaining movie that has enough laughs to keep you with it.  David Spade mugs through the role with his usual agressive, though somewhat contained, bluster.  The movie's cast consists of such stalwarts as Joe Don Baker, Rosanna Arquette, Brian Thompson (in his brief unveiling as Buffalo Bob), Adam Beach, Kathleen Freeman, Fred Ward, Dennis Miller and so on.  The meteor joke is priceless and Kid Rock's attempt at acting as Robbie is also a good joke.All in all, this isn't a classic comedy but it made me laugh.
Title: Joe Dirt

Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: # 123. Quite entertaining 2001 comedy that finds janitor / low-life / redneck wanna-be Joe Dirt (David Spade) in search of his long lost family that he hasn't seen since he was eight years old. Radio host Zander Kelly (Dennis Miller) takes a special interest in Dirt's story - as he tells it on 'air' over the course of several days. Dirt's gal pal, the sexy country girl of a small community Silvertown, Brandy (Brittany Daniel) seems to find that 'something appealing' about this society reject. Upside is that Joe Dirt turns out to be a geniune nice guy, yet many still think low and laugh at him. A humorous scene: when Buffalo Bob (Brian Thompson) keeps Dirt hostage in a 'Silence Of The Lamb' spoof. Not sure how this film did in the theaters, but it's still fun to watch on the TV.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Silly, stupid...ridiculous! Yes, you could say all of these things about "Joe Dirt"! You could also say it's funny, hilarious and damn good entertainment! This movie will grow on you with repeat viewings. A good cast and a story with some heart make this one tough to dislike. The DVD transfer and extras are very good.
summary: I KNOW "THEY" SAY I SHOULDN'T LIKE THIS MOVIE, BUT....I DO!!!
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Most people would say they are either David Spade fans or not, his humour is very unique. Spade fans will find this movie very entertaining while non Spade fans will spend the movie on the fast forward button or looking at their watches. While not his funniest movie, it is a classic David Spade film, so if you are a fan of his and haven't seen it yet, then it is definitely a great buy, but for non Spade fans probably best to keep browsing.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: When I first saw the coming attractions for this movie, it looked hilarious.  This was a funny movie, but it could have been much funnier.  David Spade plays a person who was left at the Grand Canyon when he was eight.  The plot revolves around his story of how he made it in life without parents.  There are many adventures told by Dirt on what he experienced while looking for his parents.Spade tries hard to be funny, but most of his jokes go nowhere.  Dennis Miller plays a radio DJ and is as annoying as ever.  There is a good story underneath all the gags, but it is overshadowed by too many bad jokes.  This could have been much better if the cleaned up the plot more and if more jokes would have hit.  Not a bad movie, but it could have been much better.
summary: This movie could have been cleaned up a little
Title: Joe Dirt

Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Joe Dirt is an udderly boring comedy about some moron, who was ditched by his parents at eight. David Spade suprisingly did a nice job, but the plot was horrible. Between the perverted comments and retarded jokes, Joe Dirt scores lower than dirt on my recommendations. I truly feel sorry for David Spade because this will completely ruin his image.  A radio talk-show host gets Joe to spill his life's sad story over the radio. Joe starts off by him being ditched at the Gran Canyon when he was eight. The movie continues as Joe runs into: A copy of Hannibal Lecter, a country girl named Brandy, a witness relocatee (gets him in big trouble), an Indian dude, and a large collection of other completely strange things. Joe Dirt is a complete waste of time and should not be considered a choice when selecting a movie to go see.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewerName: Sean Nolan "I love a good story"

reviewText: This movie was recommended to me by my boss, and I admit to being skeptical at first. (I'm not a big fan of sophmoric humor in general). =-)However, despite the rather blatant 'sophmoric' bits, and obligatory potty humor, I found myself engrossed and amused despite myself.Joe is such an endearing character, that to see him triumph over his tormentors was quite satisfying. I would recommend this for anyone who likes tongue and cheek humor, and can ignore the sophmoric bits.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: Joe Dirt is your everyday average janator at a radio station. The host invites Joe on to tell his life story. It goes on for 4 days until Joe Dirt is a local celebrity. He has been searching for a decade for his parents who left him in the Grand Canyon so long ago. Will his journey come to an end?

reviewText: If you like a good David spade comedy, this is a classic!  We ordered it to do a movie exchange at Christmas time, it was a hit! The product arrived in good time and condition.
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: When you sit down to watch Joe Dirt, have no ideas in your head about what it will be like. If you try to hard to hate it, or laugh at everything, or become too involved in the storyline, than you won't enjoy it.Joe Dirt is a movie that profiles a pathetic country kid on a mission to find his long-lost parents.This may sound like a cheesy plot, and if I'm honest, it is. But there are some funny jokes, and you have to laugh at Dennis Miller, who plays a stuck up DJ on an LA radio station, as he judges and critises Dirt about the sorry life he leads.The shining lights in this film are David Spade, who plays Joe, and Clem, the janitor/ex-mobster, who he ends up working with. Spade is very funny, and if you like him as Finch in Just Shoot Me, then Joe Dirt is worth a look.Perhaps the best part of the DVD is David Spade's audio commentary. In this he talks of the amount of times he had to beg producers to keep scenes in, and how he loves when someone says this or does that. His witty one-liners and unique laugh only help improve this film.Watch the movie, then listen to Spade's commentary, and the short but entertaining blooper reel, and after all this decide whether or not Joe Dirt is a good movie or not.Don't buy this DVD if you are after the best comedy ever, or an original and quality plot, but if you want some quick laughs and aren't too quick to pass judgement, then Joe Dirt might be right for you.
summary: Worth a watch for Spade fans...
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: JOE DIRT is often crude, is rather poorly edited, yet is somewhat enjoyable. David Spade plays Joe Dirt, a white trailer trash kid who was separated from his parents on a trip to the Grand Canyon. Left on his own, Joe begins a life of nomadic existence before being forced into foster care. Later, he runs away beginning his wandering life again in a quest to find his parents. He travels all around the country, working at a host of jobs from carnie worker, alligator wrangler, walking tooth, oil worker, and a janitor to name just a few. Eventually, Joe ends up in L.A. and his story is told on a misanthropic, sarcastic radio program and Joe becomes a national celebrity.JOE DIRT is rather crude and risque several times. I mean, the movie tries to make a joke out of a dog having it's testicles frozen to the floor of a front porch. However, this is an Adam Sandler produced picture so that should be expected. David Spade is sometimes funny as Joe Dirt, but more often than not he's just pathetic. Spade is great when it comes to witty, sarcastic humor; but when left to physical or situational comedy, Spade isn't that funny. The movie jumps around a lot and would have probably worked better if a lot of the radio station stuff (and Dennis Miller) was cut out and had the story told in a more coherent chronological order without the choppiness. Nevertheless, the film does have it's moments and is surprisingly funny.Overall, a rude and crude film that lacks originality and imagination, but has some humorous moments. There are a lot better movies to watch and own, yet there are also a lot of movies that are worse. Life's a garden, Dig it!
Title: Joe Dirt

reviewText: I often wuestion why so many people like certain movies, and this is one of them.  Joe Dirt is a lame movie that pokes fun at the redneck stereotype from every possible angle and still screws it up.The idea is that Joe Dirt (David Spade) is telling his life story to shock DJ Xander (Dennis Miller).  He tells of how his parents abandoned him at the Grand Canyon and his journey to find them.  However instead a funny touching movie you just get one lame joke after another until the cruelty of it all finally ends.Don't waste your time, you can find better things to do with an hour and a half.
Title: Joe Dirt
